quizzes.title: Python Introduction
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge of Python basics

questions.question: What is Python primarily used for?
options: General purpose programming with strengths in many areas
questions.explanation: Python is a versatile general-purpose language used in web development, data science, AI, automation, and more.

questions.question: Who created Python?
questions.explanation: Python was created by Guido van Rossum and first released in 1991.

questions.question: What symbol is used for comments in Python?
questions.explanation: Python uses the # symbol for single-line comments.

questions.question: Fix this code to print 'Hello World':
questions.explanation: String literals in Python must be enclosed in quotes.

quizzes.title: Python Variables
quizzes.description: Test your understanding of Python variables

questions.question: Which of the following is a valid variable name in Python?
questions.explanation: Variable names can contain letters, numbers, and underscores, but cannot start with a number or be a reserved keyword.

questions.question:
What will be the output of this code?
x = 5
x += 3
print(x)
questions.explanation: x += 3 is equivalent to x = x + 3, so x becomes 8.

questions.question: Fix this code to correctly assign multiple variables:
questions.explanation: When assigning multiple variables, separate each variable name with commas.

quizzes.title: Python Data Types
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge of Python data types

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a built-in data type in Python?
questions.explanation: Arrays are not built-in types in Python. The array-like functionality is provided by lists. NumPy provides array support as an external library.

questions.question: What is the data type of this value: {1, 2, 3}?
questions.explanation: Curly braces {} with comma-separated values (without key:value pairs) define a set in Python.

questions.question: Fix this code to create a dictionary with name and age:
questions.explanation: Dictionaries use curly braces {} not square brackets [].

quizzes.title: Python Loops
quizzes.description: Test your understanding of Python loops

questions.question: Which loop is guaranteed to execute at least once?
questions.explanation: Python doesn't have a do-while loop. Both for and while loops check their condition before the first execution.

questions.question: What does the 'continue' statement do in a loop?
options: Skips the current iteration and continues with the next one
Restarts the loop from the beginning
questions.explanation: The continue statement skips the rest of the current iteration and moves to the next iteration.

questions.question: Fix this code to print numbers from 1 to 5:
questions.explanation: range(5) generates numbers from 0 to 4. To get 1 to 5, use range(1, 6).

quizzes.title: Python Functions
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge of Python functions

questions.question: What is the correct way to define a function in Python?
questions.explanation: Python functions are defined using the 'def' keyword followed by the function name and parentheses.

questions.question: What will this function return? def add(a, b=2): return a + b
options: The sum of a and b, with b defaulting to 2 if not provided
Error because b needs a value
questions.explanation: The function adds parameters a and b, with b having a default value of 2 if not specified.

questions.question: Fix this function to calculate the area of a rectangle:
questions.codeSnippet:
def calculate_area(length, width)
    return length * width
questions.correctAnswer:
def calculate_area(length, width):
    return length * width
questions.explanation: Function definitions need a colon (:) after the parameter list.
